Description: Head bead. Head bead of usual Semitic type in opaque dark-grey-green glass. Eyes formed of globes of translucent light blue-green glass. Opaque yellow threads run from the nose to the ears. Suspension loop of the body glass to which is attached a metal, apparently iron, loop. The bead served as the pendant of an earring. Probably this was a principal function of these beads.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (398)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev George Rivers Hunter
